title: How to Cover Legs with Makeup

steps.title: Pick out an airbrush foundation to cover up imperfections on your legs.
steps.content: Pick out an airbrush foundation to cover up imperfections on your legs. Body makeup that comes in the form of a spray is a popular option because it’s easy to apply and covers up blemishes like scars or varicose veins. Choose an airbrush body foundation in a shade that matches your skin tone for the best results. [1] X Research source Unlike a tanning spray, your airbrush foundation should match your exact skin tone and will give you thicker coverage.

steps.title: Choose a self-tanning spray to add color to your legs.
steps.content: Choose a self-tanning spray to add color to your legs. Tanning sprays are great if you want to give your legs a natural-looking glow. Pick out a tanning spray that will make your legs look a shade or two darker once it’s applied, giving you a sun-kissed look. [2] X Research source The labels on tanning sprays will show you what your skin tone will look like after one application.

steps.title: Hold the mist roughly 5 in (13 cm) away from your legs as you spray.
steps.content: Hold the mist roughly 5 in (13 cm) away from your legs as you spray. This ensures you get even coverage to avoid splotches. As you move the spray along your leg, keep it the same distance from your skin the entire time so your application is as even as possible. [3] X Research source If you're worried about the spray getting on other things, spray your legs outside if it's warm or in your bathroom for easy cleanup.

steps.title: Apply the mist in an even layer all over your legs.
steps.content: Apply the mist in an even layer all over your legs. Spray the front of your legs starting at the top of your leg going all the way down to your feet, and then spray the back of your legs as well. Apply the spray in one even layer, misting your legs in an up and down pattern to be sure you cover all of your skin. [4] X Research source Stand in front of a mirror to see the back of your legs better, if you'd like.

steps.title: Rub it into your skin thoroughly if the directions say to do so.
steps.content: Rub it into your skin thoroughly if the directions say to do so. Some sprays tell you to spray the mist over your legs and then rub it in to make sure it’s completely even. If your instructions say to do this, use your hands to rub the spray in using circular motions, working it into every part of your legs. [5] X Research source Wash your hands after you rub in the spray to help get any excess makeup off of your skin. Spray tanners can stain your skin, so it's especially important to clean your hands right after you're done.

steps.title: Wait several minutes for the spray to dry before getting dressed.
steps.content: Wait several minutes for the spray to dry before getting dressed. The instructions on your spray will tell you exactly how long it takes to dry, but it’s usually about 5 minutes. After your spray dries, it’s okay to put on pants or whatever clothing you’re wearing. [6] X Research source Spray 1-2 more layers of your body makeup or self tanner, if needed. Getting dressed without waiting for the spray to dry could cause it to get on your clothing.

steps.title: Pick out a color corrector that offsets the blemish you’re trying to cover up.
steps.content: Pick out a color corrector that offsets the blemish you’re trying to cover up. Color-correcting creams are great for helping cover up dark bruises or pigmentation. Choose a color-correcting cream in a color like yellow, orange, or red to balance out the blues and purples of any imperfections. [7] X Research source For example, a yellow color corrector covers up purple bruises well.

steps.title: Apply the color corrector directly over the marks.
steps.content: Apply the color corrector directly over the marks. Color-correcting creams or concealers are best when they’re only put on top of the blemish you’re trying to balance out. Squeeze out a tiny amount of the color corrector and put it directly on top of any spots, being careful not to apply it to unblemished skin. [8] X Research source If your color corrector comes with a makeup wand for applying it, apply the corrector right on top of the spot using the wand.

steps.title: Dab the color corrector using your finger to blend it in smoothly.
steps.content: Dab the color corrector using your finger to blend it in smoothly. Instead of rubbing the color corrector into your skin, use your finger to gently dab it repeatedly until it’s covering up the area you’d like to hide. This will help the color stay in place so that it doesn’t spread too far from the spot. [9] X Research source If you’re covering up a large bruise with the color corrector, try using a beauty blender to spread it evenly.

steps.title: Add a layer of concealer over the color corrector to hide it from view.
steps.content: Add a layer of concealer over the color corrector to hide it from view. [10] X Expert Source Anjuli Yera, MD Certified Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 29 September 2021. If you don't apply a concealer overtop the color corrector, your leg will just have yellow, red, or orange markings on it that aren't super blended in. Dab a concealer that matches your skin tone right on top of the spots you've color corrected, using a beauty blender or makeup brush to create a smooth, evenly colored surface that matches your skin. [11] X Research source It's easiest to use a liquid concealer or liquid body makeup to cover up color correctors. Once your concealer is applied, your spot shouldn't be visible anymore.

steps.title: Use a stick concealer that matches your skin to cover spots on the go.
steps.content: Use a stick concealer that matches your skin to cover spots on the go. If there are just a couple spots that you’d like to cover up on your legs without using a color corrector, pick out a body concealer stick that matches your skin tone. Dab it directly on top of the spot you’d like to cover up, and blend it in with your fingers if needed. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Pick out liquid makeup for your legs that match your skin tone.
steps.content: Pick out liquid makeup for your legs that match your skin tone. Liquid body makeup is great for building up a coverage over your legs for any spots you’d like to hide. Choose a shade that matches your skin tone and that’s water-resistant so it’ll last longer. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a lotion self tanner to add a warm glow to your legs.
steps.content: Choose a lotion self tanner to add a warm glow to your legs. If you’d rather rub a self tanner into your legs instead of spraying it, pick out a tanning lotion right for your skin. They come in lots of different shades that will give you a tan that’s a shade or two darker than your natural color. [14] X Research source Tanning lotions will also help cover up small imperfections on your legs.

steps.title: Squeeze out a dollop of lotion to rub into each leg thoroughly.
steps.content: Squeeze out a dollop of lotion to rub into each leg thoroughly. Use circular motions to rub the makeup or lotion into your skin, starting at the top of your leg and working your way down to your feet. [15] X Expert Source Anjuli Yera, MD Certified Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 29 September 2021. Pay special attention to the back of your legs and make sure there aren’t any streaks as you rub. [16] X Research source For a buffed look, use a large foundation brush to spread liquid makeup into your skin. Start with a small amount to avoid using more than you actually need. Wash your hands with soap and water after you're done to get the extra makeup or lotion off.

steps.title: Use a translucent setting powder on your legs if you used body makeup.
steps.content: Use a translucent setting powder on your legs if you used body makeup. Dab a setting powder onto your legs using a loose powder brush. [17] X Expert Source Anjuli Yera, MD Certified Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 29 September 2021. Use a lot of it, powdering it on in thick layers all over your legs. Wait several minutes for the setting powder to work before dusting the top layers off with your makeup brush. [18] X Research source If you used tanning lotion, it’s not necessary to use a setting powder.
